BS161.name: Cell and Molecular Biology
BS161.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BS161.description: Macromolecular synthesis. Energy metabolism. Molecular aspects of development. Molecular genetics.
BS161.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or concurrently) or (CEM 151 or concurrently) or (LB 171 or concurrently) or (CEM 181H or concurrently)

BS162.name: Organismal and Population Biology
BS162.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BS162.description: Biological diversity and organismal biology. Principles of evolution, transmission genetics, population biology, community structure, ecology.

BS171.name: Cell and Molecular Biology Laboratory
BS171.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BS171.description: Principles and applications of common techniques used in cell and molecular biology.

BS172.name: Organismal and Population Biology Laboratory
BS172.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BS172.description: Nature and process of organismal biology including experimental design, statistical methods, hypothesis testing in genetics, ecology, and evolution.

BS181H.name: Honors Cell and Molecular Biology
BS181H.description: Physicochemical and molecular organization of cells as the unifying framework for genetics, evolution, and the social relevance of biology.
BS181H.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or concurrently) or (CEM 151 or concurrently) or (CEM 181H or concurrently) or (LB 171 or concurrently)

BS182H.name: Honors Organismal and Population Biology
BS182H.description: Diversity and basic properties of organisms, with emphasis on genetic principles, ecological interactions, and the evolutionary process. Historical approach to knowledge discovery.

BS191H.name: Honors Cell and Molecular Biology Laboratory
BS191H.description: Basic techniques of cellular and molecular biology including experimental design and hypothesis formulation; biochemistry, molecular biology and genetics.

BS192H.name: Honors Organismal and Population Biology Laboratory
BS192H.description: Nature and process of organismal biology, including experimental design and statistical methods, hypothesis testing, genetics, ecology, and evolution.
